content.description: Start matched on the incut on the left of the boulder in the crack. Traverse right using whatever hands you can find in the crack and small feet. Compress as much as you can when you get to the big boulder, swinging your feet from the left to right side. Top out via Band of Gypsies.
content.protection: One pad works as long as someone's moving it with you.

content.description: Start as for Machine Gun Funk but move into Buddy Miles. Only slightly harder
Sit start on the left side of the boulder, follow arete to the top.
content.location: Follow a trail about 50 yds north of the Machine Gun boulder; this is on the first large boulder the trail runs into.

content.description: Sit start, match hands at the left end of the lower crack (the eel's 'mouth'). Squeeze your heels and bump to the upper crack, then follow it right until you can throw for a smooth grey oval patch of rock at the lip (may want to first check it out from above to locate it). Grab the big horn and top out over the small boulder it's attached to.
content.protection: Crash pad (not the easiest to protect)
content.location: Follow a trail about 50 yds north of the Machine Gun boulder, it is left and back from Piranha.

climbs.name: Machine Gun Funk aka Susan's Arete

content.description: Perhaps the best problem at the boulder.  Machine Gun Funk has great rock, good movement, and a cool topout.  Start sitting, with sidepulls, and find your way up the arete to the little crimp and the finish.

Sit start in granite scoop, matching hands at obvious small shelf near the bottom of the finger crack. Follow crack up until the horizontal seam on the slab to the right. Shift right onto the slab, commit to your footwork, rock up and top out.
content.location: Follow a trail about 50 yds north of the Machine Gun boulder to the wall right of Piranha.

content.description:
Same start as Kingpin, but continue along finger crack to the top near a small pine tree for the finish.

When done, exit left around the tree, and up the ramp to the trail at the top of the wall.
content.location: Follow a trail about 50 yds north of the Machine Gun boulder to the wall right of Piranha.

content.description: There is a good, fairly clean, and distinct line of holds on the far left side of the boulder.  Fun movement.
Same start as Maniacal Moray, but after bumping to the upper crack, shift left and follow arete to the top.
content.location: Follow a trail about 50 yds north of the Machine Gun boulder, it is left and back from Piranha.

content.description:
Start in the scoops on the face. You may find that the easiest method is a bit dynamic. A fun problem.

A little harder if you're shorter. Start on the jugs to the right of the tree around 6 feet off the ground.

The sit start is also fun, and adds a grade.
content.location: Right of the tree on the Machine Gun boulder.

content.description: Start on the flat shelf on the left end of the boulder, get those hands in the two parallel cracks, step up, and mantle.
content.location: Left end of the boulder before the second tree

content.description:
Certainly the least fun problem at the Machine Gun, but it's still worth doing. Start sitting, and make a long reach, probably while using a drop knee.

Or, start on low feet with your left hand on an undercling and right hand on a sidepull. Big move up to a crimp and then to a slopey finish.

Traverse left a bit to top out.
content.location: Furthest right route on the boulder.

content.description: A good problem on decent rock.  For the grade, you may find a couple of tricky body positions.
content.location: Second problem on the Machine Gun boulder, from left.  Left of the tree.
